How I like to work

I like to sit down with my clients and determine their long-term goal and then break them down into mangeable milestones.

1

Discuss your goals

Depending on what we are working on, the process is different. Do you need your books cleaned? Are you preparing for a trip into an English speaking country? Which ever we do, having the endgame in mind is crucial.

2

Brain Storming and find the best process

Cleaning up your QuickBooks can mean different things. This is why determining your goal is important. By working together we can find out the best process. Should we do mass reconciliations or would breaking everything down monthly? Are you learning English? Do you have a timeframe by which you need to improve? What will you be using your English for and when? Things such as this will help in brainstorming and determining which process we will take.

3

Create an action plan

Here is where we will start building our milestones. We will determine how much time can be budgeted weekly or monthly to your endevoure.

If learning English is your goal, I can build a lesson plan based on your interests and goals. Just using any old plan will probably not help you out at all. When you are learning or improving a language using something that you are interested in will be your best bet because it is something that will hold your interests. Sometimes, even using a freetalk session will be even more helpful because it will make you think. The process will all depend on you.

4

Interaction

Depending on your goal, we can meet a couple of times a week or monthly. For QuickBooks' services, we may only need to meet for a half an hour once a month to discuss your book. We may also need to meet if there are any questions along the way.

If you are learning English, meeting once a week may be efficent if you are only needing a refresher, but if you are trying to truly improve meeting several times a week for an hour would benefit you the most. Even doing several hours during a single day would be much better for true fluency.
